div1.p: Your photo sits on my by my side and Has hardly had time to get warm since the Post man brot it-I look and look and then some more - you surely have not changed except your hair and it is so pretty.- Of course they are satisfied I have known it thru Dr Comm and Dr House- Mona said this morning where we got the photo-"Oh darn it why doesn't some good man grab her"-you must be very busy and I'm glad you are satisfied-It is so sweet of you to want to know about

sure she will do something with the violin yet Alice-will to my notions is the finest of them all-she was started to school after they came to Kirkwood-but the little thing got so homesick and she is not in school now-she is not standing still how ever is spelling every thing and writing to, and the questions she asks would keep a wise man buy. So we think she will little by being out this year. - She was five in Aug. When she saw your photo she said I think that is a nice face.-We are hoping she will sing, she is the only one of the children who ever sang around their play. - I expect to go home in a couple weeks. - am going to St. Louis to visit some people I met in Buffalo tomorrow. We go to a reception given for John by the Literary association of Kirkwood tonight will tell you all about it later lovingly alice m. neihardt.

Course you must know that they are just kids and individualists-no two have the same ambitions tho each in his way excell except in their school grades-they Enid and Sigurd make their grades but not as their daddy did - but out side of that have remarkable ability-Sigurd is doing wonderfully well in music His teacher has a music conservatory in Webster an other Suburb of St Louis and he is very proud of Sigurd the boy practices at least three hours a day He is playing Bethoven, Greeg, Chopan and McDowell-McDowell and is just part 14 - Enid will be an expert in Stenography. - Her father says she has a wonderful understanding of words and an insight for with the things he shoudl take care of-they are such good friends and she loves her father dearly.-Is a beautiful girl and no matter of fact and just past 15.-

Hilda, Ten. has her father's mind is a great reader, her repart cards are alway dissected with E's and S's once in a while an M. Her mother started her on the violin but she is happier when she is doing things with her brain-So at present we are not very encouraged about Hilda's music altho I feel
